meanings.sent1: The cabby drove us to the airport.
meanings.sent2: I hailed a cabby to take me downtown.
meanings.sent3: The cabby joked with his passengers during the ride.
meanings.sent4: She navigated the city streets like a skilled cabby.
meanings.sent5: The friendly cabby always had a story to share with his customers.

meanings.definition: A person who drives a cab.
meanings.sent1: The cabby helped load the luggage into the taxi.
meanings.sent2: My friend became a cabby after retiring from his office job.
meanings.sent3: The cabby's hat flew off in the wind, making everyone laugh.
meanings.sent4: She maneuvered through traffic expertly, a true cabby.
meanings.sent5: The cabby's cheerful demeanor brightened up the rainy day for his passengers.

meanings.sent1: I will cabby for extra cash on weekends.
meanings.sent2: She cabbyed through the busy city streets with ease.
meanings.sent3: He decided to cabby part-time while studying at college.
meanings.sent4: The tourists were amazed at how well she cabbyed in an unfamiliar city.
meanings.sent5: Cabbying requires good knowledge of the city roads and traffic patterns.
